llm.feedback: The draft has strong backbone (clear regime framing, explicit policy-to-market transmission, and multiple source fragments tied to a coherent macro narrative), but to reach world-class quality you should tighten discipline around four concrete outputs, anchor every claim to specific IDs, and remove ambiguity/conflicts. Actionable edits in one paragraph: (1) Rebuild Movers to strictly 4 lines (2 Up, 2 Down) with exact format: Up | 0–3 weeks | Driver/Mechanism | What to watch | Probability %; Up | 3–6 months | Driver/Mechanism | What to watch | Probability %; Down | 0–3 weeks | Driver/Mechanism | What to watch | Probability %; Down | 3–6 months | Driver/Mechanism | What to watch | Probability %; tie each line to a single, source-backed catalyst (e.g., GX057ADL7 for near‑term easing/september cut, XQWTVR71K for 2‑yr yield move, 37UZC9X8I for inflation/hawkish Jackson Hole, H7Q52FKDH for Chips Act/geopolitics); use crisp, evidence-based probabilities (e.g., 60% and 25–30% ranges) rather than ad hoc numbers. (2) For catalysts/triggers/invalidation, present a short, testable rule per line (e.g., “trigger: September cut odds ≥70% as per Fed odds curve; invalidation: Fed signals no near-term cuts or dollar/yields reprice materially”). (3) Ground the base-case and alt scenarios in first-principles causal chain (policy stance → financial conditions → capex/risk appetite → asset pricing) and explicitly enumerate Regime A/B/C switch thresholds with explicit data points (CPI/payroll, Jackson Hole guidance, tariff/export-control signals; sources: GX057ADL7, 37UZC9X8I, XQWTVR71K, H7Q52FKDH, J99EM2TPZ). (4) Clean up the Swing Trade section: confirm INTC is tradable in the horizon; present a single, precise line with Entry/Stop/Target/Risk-Reward/Invalidation/Trigger/Probability/Confidence, or, if staying within the four-movers constraint, move the INTC line into the Outlook section as a dedicated 1‑line Swing Trade with concrete price levels; ensure the numbers match the cited pricing anchors (e.g., use explicit ranges from GX057ADL7 or XQWTVR71K where applicable). (5) Tighten numbers to avoid contradictions: for example, unify the easing path (25–50 bp September cut vs 150–175 bp total) under GX057ADL7 while noting mid-4% 10-year and dollar90 softness as ranges; flag any inconsistent profitability or revenue figures (TN66GHPAT) for verification and either remove or annotate as provisional. (6) Improve citation discipline: place IDs only after facts/numbers that rely on them, avoid stacking sources for qualitative claims, ensure all critical data points have a matching ID, and explicitly acknowledge conflicts between sources (e.g., Regime A vs Regime B signals) with a brief reconciliation note. (7) Finally, tighten formatting and length: keep the Movers strictly 4 lines, drop extraneous narrative from the Movers block, and ensure the Outlook line(s) stay within 1–2 lines as required.
